cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to stall near the coast through the weekend while drifting slowly
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O'Connor–Corpus Christi

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of San Luis Pass to High Island TX (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Matagorda to High Island TX (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast, including High Island–Port Arthur area and southwestern Louisiana shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are likely at the port beginning late Friday into the weekend.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 2–4 ft above ground are possible for the coast from San Luis Pass to High Island, which includes the Beaumont/Port Arthur area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 12–20 inches of rain with locally higher totals could fall over the upper Texas coast, producing life-threatening freshwater flooding in the Beaumont area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged flooding due to the storm stalling near the coast; dangerous rip currents and rough seas that will disrupt marine and port operations.
